com.jfoenix.effects

Class JFXDepthManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jfoenix.effects.JFXDepthManager

  • public class JFXDepthManager
extends java.lang.Object
    it will create a shadow effect for a given node and a specified depth level. depth levels are {0,1,2,3,4,5}
    Since:
    2016-03-09

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JFXDepthManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static javafx.scene.Node createMaterialNode(javafx.scene.Node control, int level)
      this method will generate a new container node that prevent control transformation to be applied to the shadow effect (which makes it looks as a real shadow)
      static int getLevels() 
      static javafx.scene.effect.DropShadow getShadowAt(int level) 
      static void pop(javafx.scene.Node control) 
      static void setDepth(javafx.scene.Node control, int level)
      this method is used to add shadow effect to the node, however the shadow is not real ( gets affected with node transformations)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • JFXDepthManager

        public JFXDepthManager()

    • Method Detail

      • setDepth

        public static void setDepth(javafx.scene.Node control,
                            int level)
        this method is used to add shadow effect to the node, however the shadow is not real ( gets affected with node transformations)

        use createMaterialNode(Node, int) instead to generate a real shadow

      • getLevels

        public static int getLevels()

      • getShadowAt

        public static javafx.scene.effect.DropShadow getShadowAt(int level)

      • createMaterialNode

        public static javafx.scene.Node createMaterialNode(javafx.scene.Node control,
                                                   int level)
        this method will generate a new container node that prevent control transformation to be applied to the shadow effect (which makes it looks as a real shadow)

      • pop

        public static void pop(javafx.scene.Node control)
